description: UGC asked educational institutions to not forfeit the full fee from students who don't join. They should rather deduct not more than Rs 1,000 and refund the rest amount. The institutions have also been asked to not retain original certificates forcing retention of admitted students.
title: UGC to institutes: Refund fees and return certificates

description: In an innovative move, the Higher Education Department of Haryana roped in a Gurgaon-based music band – Paddy Boyz – for a series of concerts and musical workshops, which will be conducted at various colleges across the state.
title: Now, education in Haryana through musical workshops

description: Visva-Bharati vice-chancellor Sushanta Duttagupta joined duty on Monday — the quiet “re-entry” triggering more commotion and controversy than his dramatic midnight departure a month ago, after having mailed his resignation letter to President Pranab Mukherjee.
title: Visva-Bharati vice-chancellor rejoins office

description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has decided to scrap Problem Solving Assessment (PSA) tests for classes IX and XI from the 2015-2016 academic year. The tests assessed students on their ability to solve application-based problems.
title: CBSE scraps assessment tests for classes IX, XI

description: Her assertion came on a day when she met an eight-member delegation including representatives from students union of Delhi University and Jawaharlal Nehru University her at her residence.
title: Non-NET fellowship not to be discontinued, Smriti Irani says

description: The religious body also recommended that students appearing for competitive examinations should be allowed to answer questions in Urdu.
title: Pak body wants separate women educational institutes

description: The Gujarat Forensic Science University (GFSU) and Canberra Institute of Technology (CIT) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for students, teachers and technology exchange programme, a statement said.
title: Guj, Australian varsity ink MoU for exchange programme

description: DU students and Pinjra Tod campaigners Shambhavi Vikram Singh and Subhashini Shriya received calls from an unknown mobile number, threatening to "beat [them] up" for pasting their posters over some others on the Wall of Democracy in North Campus.
title: Pinjra Tod campaigners threatened to be "beaten up" for pasting posters

description: Bedridden for four years, Paawan Gaur (19), a resident of Kota, grabs a seat in the prestigious University of California, San Diego in the US, along with an internship offer from Nasa.
title: Bedridden Kota boy bags a seat in Univ of California

description: Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS) along with BMC’s M-east ward held a workshop on - Total Sanitation at the TISS campus on Friday.
title: Workshop on total sanitation at TISS Mumbai

description: A 50-year-old railway employee in Mumbai has been doubling up as teacher for scores of needy students and children of his colleagues for the past three decades, helping them crack several competitive exams.
title: Rly man combines passion & education to teach for free

description: Plan is to carry out local research
title: ISI to set up campus in Tezpur, Assam

description: About 5,000 turned up for Aam Aadmi Party's "DU Rocks" concert, organized, essentially, to support its student wing, Chhatra Yuva Sangharsh Samiti's maiden effort at contesting the Delhi University Students' Union elections.
title: Kejriwal exhorts students to 'clean up' DU politics

description: Voicing concern over heavy school bags carried by students, the Bombay High Court today asked Maharashtra government to expeditiously take a decision on implementation of a resolution passed by it that seeks to address the problem.
title: Heavy school bags weigh on HC mind

description: The K J Somaiya Centre for Buddhist Studies in Mumbai has announced introductory courses in Pali.
title: Mumbai: New courses in Pali language from September

description: Any disabled student who has passed Class 10, can apply for the diploma course.
title: Artist opens fine arts college for the disabled in Tamil Nadu

description: The Gujarat University has said that 72 per cent of the seats in the Master of Computer Application (MCA) and Master of Business Administration (MBA) will stay vacant this year because the online admission process ended on Wednesday — only 7,000 students had registered against the availability of 25,004 seats.
title: Gujarat University MCA and MBA seats vacant

description: The Class X and XII board results of Central Board of Secondary Education will be declared on the third and fourth week of May respectively.
title: CBSE Board results by May end

description: The academic session has begun but most students of schools in Odisha's Ganjam district are yet to have their text books.
title: No text books for students in Ganjam

description: As many as 18 UGC-funded central universities have introduced Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels to bring about qualitative improvement in higher education.
title: 18 central varsity introduce choice-based credit system
